intro: Popowia ochroleuca, commonly known as the white-leaved popowia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that are often pale green to white in color. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and yellow stamens. Popowia ochroleuca is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
